meanings.definition: The act of tracking or tracing something.
meanings.sent1: I used the trackages to follow the footprints in the snow.
meanings.sent2: The detective relied on the trackages to solve the mystery.
meanings.sent3: The trackages of the lost dog led us straight to the ice cream truck.
meanings.sent4: Her keen trackages of the suspect's movements helped catch the thief.
meanings.sent5: The trackages of the explorer were so precise that he never got lost.

meanings.definition: The collection of tracks or traces left behind.
meanings.sent1: The forest was full of animal trackages from various creatures.
meanings.sent2: The archaeologist studied the trackages left by ancient civilizations.
meanings.sent3: The trackages in the sand revealed the path of the elusive crab.
meanings.sent4: The trackages of history can teach us valuable lessons.
meanings.sent5: The trackages of the hikers guided us through the dense forest.

meanings.definition: The process of monitoring or following something.
meanings.sent1: The trackages of the satellite allowed us to observe the weather patterns.
meanings.sent2: The trackages of the suspect led the police to his hideout.
meanings.sent3: The trackages of the student's progress showed steady improvement.
meanings.sent4: The trackages of the migrating birds fascinated the researchers.
meanings.sent5: The trackages of the delivery truck ensured timely shipments.
